body: Naval radar was also key in BVR targeting. That’s why the giants Yamato and Musashi were fairly useless despite fielding the largest naval guns in history. Sure, those guns could outshoot and sink almost anything, but the radar system was woefully inadequate for the task. What’s the use of a big gun if you can’t hit anything with it? Now, the Yamato did see some action, but it’s only damaged a few smaller ships and sank one. None of them were battleships, carriers, or even heavy cruisers

body: My best friend of 28ish years ghosted me. I asked him if he was up for driving us (him, me and my brother in law) up to london for an event. I normally drive. He then backed out the event, stopped returning my calls, read but didn’t answer the dozens of txts. Lied to his family and my family about me. His sister ghosted me too. While my older brother was travelling the world he met up with him, took a load of momentous and keep sakes back to the Uk with him. They were mysteriously lost. He was like a brother to me. I hear he’s married and has a kid now. 🖕

author: SanjitheSnack

body:
I was maybe ten. We all slept outside on this girl’s trampoline. Someone put shaving cream in every girl’s hair except mine. I was framed for the prank. 

I knew I was innocent, and my hair was fine, so I really didn’t care. I noticed a lot of those girls were unfriendly to me after that night. It didn’t matter, but that experience stuck with me. 

I wish I knew who did that and why. It must have been the girl who lived there, because I don’t know how anyone could have concealed having a can of shaving cream when we hung out on the trampoline all night without bags or our stuff.

author: SisterYahtzee

body:
Wired headphones don't need charging, have better quality, don't disconnect, are cheaper, are harder to lose, and can save the phone from hitting the floor if you drop it etc. You also don't need to take a dongle with you to use the headphones, and can charge and use the headphone jack at the same time.

Plus, if you have a port, nothing's stopping you from using bluetooth anyway - you still have the option.

It's just... better.

Plus I live somewhere with shit data signal, and it's nice to have things off cloud. I don't need to worry about finding free wifi if my 100gb of music etc is literally on my phone no matter what. I live in a city too - just in a rural area. (Exeter, England.) SD cards are great for that ease of access, and instant access, or easy transfer of photos/film etc.

body:
That you should be loyal to a company or business or manager. Your loyalty to a business is to do your job that you are paid for for and nothing more. A business will layoff people in an instant if they need to and do not care that you uave put in 80 hours a week for the past ten years. 

You are a number on a spreadsheet. Family and friends will be there for you, colleagues won't. Businesses are an entity, not a family. You are paid to do a job and nothing more, so don't give anything away for free and do not give your life to them over your actual family.

author: CanlexGaming

body: You motorboating son of a bitch

Well, Medicare is by far the largest and most efficient health insurer, so there’s that one. There’s the forest service and the bureau of land management which oversees vast woodlands and natural resources. The state and national parks systems - haven’t seen any corporate parks developed yet. Certainly none without an inducement from… the government. There’s the social security administration which oversees the largest pension, for which few private comparisons even exist anymore. You’ve got the federal bankruptcy court system which is a model for the rest of the world and is left to clean up the pieces when corporations fail, so let’s count that one. 

Seems to me like you haven’t spent much time around corporations. They’re not infallible efficiency machines. They’re capacity constrained just like everything else. Waiting in line at the DMV doesn’t mean they’re doing a bad job, it means that they have limited throughput and have to service everyone who comes calling in the order they arrived. 

I don’t know about you, but I can’t remember the last time someone “popped over” and asked to help as soon as I walked into a store. 

Maybe I’m just not weighting long enough for them to come by.
